author: annhilaterlb
content: Can miner's include a transaction where the max fee is less than the base fee + priority Fee but where the max fee is still greater than the base fee? For example could a miner include a transaction that had a base fee of 100 Gwei/gas and a priority fee of 10 but a max fee of 105?

author: pipermerriam
content: I don't know the answer to your question but you can probably find it here: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1559#specification

author: annhilaterlb
content: From the EIP: The transaction will always pay the base fee per gas of the block it was included in, and they will pay the priority fee per gas set in the transaction, as long as the combined amount of the two fees doesnâ€™t exceed the transactionâ€™s maximum fee per gas.

author: annhilaterlb
content: I may be misunderstanding it, but it seems to be saying that it can not be included in a block.

author: annhilaterlb
content: It seems suboptimal though if a user has sent a transaction that covers the base fee and the miner is willing to accept the remainder as a tip, to not let it be included.

author: pietjepuk
content: Probably misunderstanding it then, because it definitely is possible! As long as maxFeePerGas >= baseFeePerGas, a tx can be included

author: pietjepuk
content: note that an EIP-1559-style tx specifies **max**PriorityFeePerGas, not priorityFeePerGas, so indeed the _actual_ priority fee will be lower in the case you described

author: pietjepuk
content: that's the logic right there btw (in the EIP)
